summary: The '504 Credit Risk Management Improvement Act of 2025' amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to enhance the Office of Credit Risk Management. It outlines the Office's responsibilities, including supervising certified development companies, conducting loan closing file reviews, and taking enforcement actions. The bill also mandates the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to issue rules clarifying environmental compliance procedures for certified development companies under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. Additionally, it requires annual risk analysis reports to Congress.
